titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the W. Kenneth Riland papers FA1255
titlestmt.author: Harold Oakhill (1996-1997), Amy Berish (2021)

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-11-01 03:57:33 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Material containing personal information on the W. Kenneth Riland family is closed until June 27, 2042.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The W. Kenneth Riland papers are arranged as follows:
Series 2: United States v Riland Tax Evasion Trial
Series 4: Medical and Medical School Documents
Series 5: White House Papers from Nixon's Term

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The W. Kenneth Riland papers were donated by the Riland Family on June 27, 1992.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC has title, copyright and literary rights to the papers in so far as it holds them.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: W. Kenneth Riland was a leading figure in the field of osteopathic medicine and co-founder of the New York College of Osteopathic Medicine in Old Westbury, New York. He served as personal physician to Nelson A. Rockefeller and Richard M. Nixon, among other prominent figures. He accompanied Nelson Rockefeller on a number of trips including the 1969 trip to Latin America. He was also an associate of Richard Nixon and accompanied him on his trip to China.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The W. Kenneth Riland papers contain diaries, correspondence, campaign material, trial documents regarding Riland's tax evasion case, photographs, a scrapbook and assorted ephemera from various trips and events.

controlaccess.subject: Osteopathic medicine
Rockefeller, Nelson A. (Nelson Aldrich), 1908-1979 -- Political and social views
Watergate Affair, 1972-1974

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Riland kept a detailed diary from 1968-1972 and for intermittent periods between 1959-1968 and 1972-1979. Included in his diaries are trips with Nelson Rockefeller during Nelson's gubernatorial and presidential campaigns, as well as trips abroad before and during his vice presidency. Riland also kept detailed accounts of his trips with President Richard Nixon to Europe, Russian, the Middle East, and China. Riland also wrote about the business and personal sides of his life. Included in the diaries are recollections of conversations with Nelson, Happy, Laurance, and other members of the Rockefeller family, as well as discussions with Henry Kissinger, Chief Justice Burgher, Rose Mary Woods, John Mitchell, and many others Riland shared a social relationship with.

Although Riland aimed to document events as they were despite having personal relationships and a sense of confidence with those he was documenting, it is important to note that these "diaries" were written with the intent that they would eventually be published.

Riland originally used tapes to record his daily events, however the Archive Center does not have possession of these recordings. Riland's secretary transcribed the tapes to their current form. Most of the documents in this series are typed unless otherwise stated (e.g. there are some entries that are handwritten by Riland, but most of these also exist in typed form.) There are also duplicates of certain periods as well as folders that have overlapping dates that cover roughly the same period of time, plus or minus a few weeks.

United States v. Riland Tax Evasion Trial

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In 1974, Riland faced tax evasion charges in a widely publicized case in New York City. The case lasted several weeks from March-May 1974. Ultimately, the jury found Riland not guilty of the charges. This series contains news clippings, personal notes, and legal documents that were kept by Riland. A large portion of this series consists of the trial's transcripts as well as copies of the hearings before the trial, including the testimony and suppression hearings.

did.unittitle: U.S. Senate Report of Proceedings, Select Committee on Presidential Campaign Activities - Senate Resolution 60: General Investigation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains obituaries, news clippings, appointment calendars, a biographical sketch, family history papers, personal memos, invitations, and artifacts of Riland's time in Albany and Washington.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Memorabilia related to Mexico and New Zealand trips, Dr. Riland's Physician to the Governor Badge, notepads, and contact cards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains information on the New York State School of Osteopathy which was founded by Riland, as well as the Post Graduate Institute of Osteopathy. Also included are documents pertaining to foriegn medicine, and acupuncture.

scopecontent.p: This series contains memos, congressional and senate papers, campaign schedules, as well as the commutation papers of Jimmy Hoffa, and magazine covers autographed by Nixon and Haldeman.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is dedicated to Riland's trips with Nelson Rockefeller and Richard Nixon. Folders contain official schedules, pamphlets, and mentions of many other of Riland's visits. More information regarding these trips can be found in the Diaries series.

did.unittitle: Momentos from Trips Abroad with Nixon and Nelson Rockefeller

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records pertaining to Nelson Rockefeller and includes information on Rockefeller Brothers Fund projects as well as Congressional hearings over the entrance of the new Ford administration in 1975. Also included is Nelson's Quality of Life Report on Latin America, schedules of his campaign trips within the state of New York in 1962, to the Midwest in 1959, and across the nation in 1964 and to Europe in 1963. Also included are memos exchanged between Riland and Nelson Rockefeller, a copy of his Vice Presidential speech and assorted funeral materials.

scopecontent.p: This series contains news clippings about many of Riland's famous patients, Nixon and Watergate, Tom Seaver and Henry Kissinger.

did.unittitle: Tom Seaver, Riland Banquet, School of Osteopathy, Nixon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains various photographs that were originally housed in a bound album. Additionally, clippings, mementos, and articles found in a scrapbook have been removed from their original housing and filed accordingly.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Restricted - confidential material. Closed until June 27, 2042 as per the deed of gift. Originally, the material was reviewed by archivist Harold Oakhill. Pages from the diaries containing information to be closed were photocopied and restricted. The final restricted copy was placed in the open diary papers, and the originals have been placed in a sealed, half size letter box at the end of the collection. During processing in 2021, the folder was unsealed and reviewed again by Amy Berish. The papers will continue to remain closed until 2042 as per the deed of gift.
